column4: how do you access administration in cups (localhost:631) ?  the printer-manager doesn't let me name/rename or alter any printers, and logging in as root doesn't seem to be working
sudo adduser cupsys shadow
what does the shadow group do?
the shadow group can read the encrypted passwords, so it can let you login to the web interface
yes, as if the hard disk is spinning up
any ideas?
exactly... and if you're typing several letters are either dropped or repeated
no not that, they just take some time to 'arrive' on the screen
mine actually get dropped, depending on how furiously I'm typing...   this problem seems to be ubuntu specific...
try fiddling with the power management setting to prevent the hard drive from spinning down
I seem to remember someone saying that the powernowd daemon was causing problems... what else should I check?
/etc/init.d/powernowd stop seems to have corrected the problem.   Does powernow actually control the disk, or would that just be my processor speed changing ?
it can, use 'rescue' as boot option
I tried that, but it keeps telling me that it cannot mount /dev/sda6 as the root partition and panics
hmm, you might need to use a live cd then
if I use the live cd, am I supposed to mount everything and chroot into it?
what are grub commands for having grub install itself onto a given partition?
read that wikipage
I'm looking for it now, what's it titled?
http://wiki.ubuntu.com/RecoverinUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
thanks.  Sorry... I'm a lilo guy until recently
